entry.title: app-generator/django-soft-dashboard-tailwind
entry.summary:
Django Soft UI Dashboard - Tailwind CSS (Open-Source) | AppSeed

Soft Dashboard Tailwind Django

Open-source Django Dashboard generated by AppSeed op top of a modern design. Designed for those who like bold elements and beautiful websites, Soft UI Dashboard is ready to help you create stunning websites and webapps. Soft UI Dashboard is built with over 70 frontend individual elements, like buttons, inputs, navbars, nav tabs, cards, or alerts, giving you the freedom of choosing and combining.


  • ðŸ‘‰ Soft Dashboard Tailwind Django - product page
  • ðŸ‘‰ Soft Dashboard Tailwind Django - LIVE Demo
  • âœ… Free Support (registered users) via Email and Discord

Features

  • CSS Framework: Tailwind
  • Up-to-date dependencies
  • Database: sqlite
  • UI-Ready app, Django Native ORM
  • Session-Based authentication, Forms validation


âœ¨ Start the app in Docker

Step 1 - Download the code from the GH repository (using GIT)

$ # Get the code
$ git clone https://github.com/app-generator/django-soft-dashboard-tailwind.git
$ cd django-soft-dashboard-tailwind

Step 2 - Edit .env and remove or comment all DB_* settings (DB_ENGINE=...).

DEBUG=True

# Deployment SERVER address
SERVER=.appseed.us

# For MySql Persistence
# DB_ENGINE=mysql            <-- REMOVE or comment for Docker
# DB_NAME=appseed_db         <-- REMOVE or comment for Docker  
# DB_HOST=localhost          <-- REMOVE or comment for Docker 
# DB_PORT=3306               <-- REMOVE or comment for Docker
# DB_USERNAME=appseed_db_usr <-- REMOVE or comment for Docker
# DB_PASS=<STRONG_PASS>      <-- REMOVE or comment for Docker

Step 3 - Start the APP in Docker

$ docker-compose up --build

Visit http://localhost:5085 in your browser. The app should be up & running.


âœ¨ How to use it

Download the code

$ # Get the code
$ git clone https://github.com/app-generator/django-soft-dashboard-tailwind.git
$ cd django-soft-dashboard-tailwind

ðŸ‘‰ Set Up for Unix, MacOS

Install modules via VENV

$ virtualenv env
$ source env/bin/activate
$ pip3 install -r requirements.txt

Set Up Database

$ python manage.py makemigrations
$ python manage.py migrate

Start the app

$ python manage.py runserver

At this point, the app runs at http://127.0.0.1:8000/.


ðŸ‘‰ Set Up for Windows

Install modules via VENV (windows)

$ virtualenv env
$ .\env\Scripts\activate
$ pip3 install -r requirements.txt

Set Up Database

$ python manage.py makemigrations
$ python manage.py migrate

Start the app

$ python manage.py runserver

At this point, the app runs at http://127.0.0.1:8000/.


âœ¨ Create Users

By default, the app redirects guest users to authenticate. In order to access the private pages, follow this set up:

  • Start the app via flask run
  • Access the registration page and create a new user:
    • http://127.0.0.1:8000/register/
  • Access the sign in page and authenticate
    • http://127.0.0.1:8000/login/

âœ¨ Code-base structure

The project is coded using a simple and intuitive structure presented below:

< PROJECT ROOT >
   |
   |-- core/                               # Implements app configuration
   |    |-- settings.py                    # Defines Global Settings
   |    |-- wsgi.py                        # Start the app in production
   |    |-- urls.py                        # Define URLs served by all apps/nodes
   |
   |-- apps/
   |    |
   |    |-- home/                          # A simple app that serve HTML files
   |    |    |-- views.py                  # Serve HTML pages for authenticated users
   |    |    |-- urls.py                   # Define some super simple routes  
   |    |
   |    |-- authentication/                # Handles auth routes (login and register)
   |    |    |-- urls.py                   # Define authentication routes  
   |    |    |-- views.py                  # Handles login and registration  
   |    |    |-- forms.py                  # Define auth forms (login and register) 
   |    |
   |    |-- static/
   |    |    |-- <css, JS, images>         # CSS files, Javascripts files
   |    |
   |    |-- templates/                     # Templates used to render pages
   |         |-- includes/                 # HTML chunks and components
   |         |    |-- navigation.html      # Top menu component
   |         |    |-- sidebar.html         # Sidebar component
   |         |    |-- footer.html          # App Footer
   |         |    |-- scripts.html         # Scripts common to all pages
   |         |
   |         |-- layouts/                   # Master pages
   |         |    |-- base-fullscreen.html  # Used by Authentication pages
   |         |    |-- base.html             # Used by common pages
   |         |
   |         |-- accounts/                  # Authentication pages
   |         |    |-- login.html            # Login page
   |         |    |-- register.html         # Register page
   |         |
   |         |-- home/                      # UI Kit Pages
   |              |-- index.html            # Index page
   |              |-- 404-page.html         # 404 page
   |              |-- *.html                # All other pages
   |
   |-- requirements.txt                     # Development modules - SQLite storage
   |
   |-- .env                                 # Inject Configuration via Environment
   |-- manage.py                            # Start the app - Django default start script
   |
   |-- ************************************************************************

âœ¨ Customize CSS

  • Edit the apps/static/assets/scss/styles.css
  • Regenerate the CSS
$ npm i
$ npm run build

Soft Dashboard Tailwind Django - Open-source starter generated by AppSeed Generator.

entry.title: lukepolson/youtube_channel
entry.summary:
Notebooks for the python tutorials of my youtube channel. See specific youtube video for link to specifc notebook.

Youtube Channel Repository

Contained here is all the code contained in my videos on youtube. I have a docker image that will make things simple (no need to worry about dependencies when running my code)!

https://hub.docker.com/r/lukepolson/psolver_base

To run this Docker image using Docker Desktop (I'm assuming the linux users are already proficient/can follow this and use terminal commands)

  1. Pull the repository using docker pull lukepolson/psolver_base. You need to use windows powershell or a MAC terminal

  2. Open Docker Desktop, go to images, and click run:

  3. Configure the optional settings as follows:

4. Go to windows powershell, use the command docker ps -a to see all running containers and look at the ID. Then use docker logs <ID> to get the logs for that container. Copy the token for the jupyter login.

  1. Open up google chrome, type in the search bar localhost:8888/lab and you will be in the correct environment!

entry.title: codewithsadee/vcard-personal-portfolio
entry.summary:
vCard is a fully responsive personal portfolio website, responsive for all devices.

vCard - Personal portfolio

vCard is a fully responsive personal portfolio website, responsive for all devices, built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Demo

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have met the following requirements:

  • Git must be installed on your operating system.

Installing vCard

To install vCard, follow these steps:

Linux and macOS:

sudo git clone https://github.com/codewithsadee/vcard-personal-portfolio.git

Windows:

git clone https://github.com/codewithsadee/vcard-personal-portfolio.git

Contact

If you want to contact me you can reach me at Twitter.

License

This project is free to use and does not contains any license.
